function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Endogenous biomarkers present in sewage systems can be used to estimate the real-time population served by the system, posing a risk of privacy invasion.","Impact":"Unauthorized exposure of the real-time population served by the sewage system, potentially leading to privacy concerns and ethical issues.","Mitigation":"Implement strict data anonymization and privacy protection measures to ensure that individual identities are not revealed.","Technologies":"Data anonymization techniques, encryption, and secure data storage.","People":"Population served by sewage system, public health authorities, data protection agencies.","Owner":"Public health authorities, sewage system operators, data protection agencies."},{"Description":"The identification and monitoring of disease biomarkers in sewage systems could lead to the unintentional disclosure of health information of entire populations.","Impact":"Unintended exposure of sensitive health information of entire populations, leading to privacy breaches and ethical concerns.","Mitigation":"Implement strict data protection measures and comply with privacy regulations to safeguard sensitive health information.","Technologies":"Secure data storage, encryption, data access controls, and compliance with health data privacy regulations.","People":"Population served by sewage system, public health authorities, data protection agencies.","Owner":"Public health authorities, sewage system operators, data protection agencies."},{"Description":"Proteomic identification of disease biomarkers in sewage systems may lead to the unintentional tracking and monitoring of health conditions of different populations, potentially violating privacy and ethical standards.","Impact":"Invasion of privacy through the tracking and monitoring of health conditions of populations, raising ethical concerns and privacy issues.","Mitigation":"Implement strict privacy measures and obtain ethical approvals for research involving the monitoring of health conditions in sewage systems.","Technologies":"Ethical approvals, data protection regulations, secure data handling, and privacy assessments.","People":"Population served by sewage system, public health authorities, data protection agencies, research ethics committees.","Owner":"Public health authorities, sewage system operators, research ethics committees."}]}
